verbose_text: In a retroviral insertional mutagenesis screen for genes that cooperate with haploinsufficiency of another del (5q) MDS / AML gene, Egr1, mice that developed a myeloid neoplasm consistently harbored insertional sites that disrupted genomic regions proximal to the TIFAB locus, suggesting that loss of TIFAB is important for the biology of pre-leukemic myeloid neoplasms.
